1.name: Frau im Mond
1.description: A tenacious scientist blasts off for the moon in hopes of riches that may be found there.

2.name: Die Büchse der Pandora
2.description: The rise and inevitable fall of an amoral but naive young woman whose insouciant eroticism inspires lust and violence in those around her.

3.name: The Wolf Song
3.description: In 1840, Sam Lash heads west for adventure. He meets up with some Mountain Men, and they head for the Rockies to trap beavers and cats. In Taos he meets Lola, a beautiful Mexican girl from ...                See full summary »

4.name: Blackmail
4.description: After killing a man in self-defense, a young woman is blackmailed by a witness to the killing.

5.name: The Virginian
5.description: A good-natured cowboy who is romancing the new schoolmarm has a crisis of conscience when he discovers his best friend is engaged in cattle rustling.

6.name: The Broadway Melody
6.description: A pair of sisters from the vaudeville circuit try to make it big time on Broadway, but matters of the heart complicate the attempt.

7.name: Tagebuch einer Verlorenen
7.description: After falling pregnant to a pharmacist and refusing to marry, a young woman is thrown from her home and sent to a scrict girls' reform school.

8.name: Piccadilly
8.description: A young Chinese woman, working in the kitchen at a London dance club, is given the chance to become the club's main act which soon leads to a plot of betrayal, forbidden love and murder.

9.name: The Cocoanuts
9.description: During the Florida land boom, The Marx Brothers run a hotel, auction off some land, thwart a jewel robbery, and generally act like themselves.

10.name: The Love Parade
10.description: The queen of mythical Sylvania marries a courtier, who finds his new life unsatisfying.

11.name: The Single Standard
11.description: The wealthy Arden Stuart is bored in a party; after refusing the wedding proposal of Tommy Hewlett, she drives her car with her driver to a lonely place. She has one night stand with him ...                See full summary »

12.name: The Hollywood Revue of 1929
12.description: An all-star revue featuring MGM contract players.

13.name: The Four Feathers
13.description: When British officer Harry resigns from his regiment, he is labeled a coward by his family and friends. Harry receives four white feathers as a mark of a coward. In order to redeem himself ...                See full summary »

14.name: The Canary Murder Case
14.description: A beautiful showgirl, nicknamed 'the Canary', is a scheming nightclub singer. Blackmailing is her game and soon ends up dead. But who killed 'the Canary'. All the suspects who knew her had ...                See full summary »

15.name: Disraeli
15.description: Prime Minister of Great Britain Benjamin Disraeli outwits the subterfuge of the Russians and chicanery at home in order to secure the purchase of the Suez Canal.

16.name: The Manxman
16.description: A fisherman and a rising young lawyer, who grew up as brothers, fall in love with the same girl.

17.name: The Taming of the Shrew
17.description: In sixteenth century Padua, Hortensio loves Bianca, the youngest daughter of Baptista. But Baptista will not allow the two to get married until his eldest daughter, the extremely headstrong...                See full summary »

18.name: The Kiss
18.description: An unhappily married woman is caught up in scandal and murder when her affection toward a young man is misinterpreted.

19.name: The Wild Party
19.description: Wild girls at a college pay more attention to parties than their classes. But when one party girl, Stella Ames, goes too far at a local bar and gets in trouble, her professor has to rescue ...                See full summary »

20.name: Asphalt
20.description: Joe May's sensual drama of life in the Berlin underworld is in many ways the perfect summation of German filmmaking in the silent era: a dazzling visual style, a psychological approach to ...                See full summary »

21.name: The Iron Mask
21.description: King Louis XIII of France is thrilled to have born to him a son - an heir to the throne. But when the queen delivers a twin, Cardinal Richelieu sees the second son as a potential for ...                See full summary »

22.name: The Great Gabbo
22.description: An insanely, egocentric ventriloquist, even though he is possessed by his wooden dummy, is in love with a dancer who is in love with another. The dummy gives advice to the ventriloquist.

23.name: Coquette
23.description: A flirtatious Southern belle is compromised with one of her suitors.

24.name: The Trespasser
24.description: The trial and tribulations of a strong-willed woman who elopes and gives birth out of wedlock without telling her ex-husband.

25.name: The Letter
25.description: Jeanne Eagels plays the bored and restless Leslie Crosbie who turns to another man, Geoffrey Hammond (Herbert Marshall) for attention when neglected by her husband Robert (Reginald Owen). ...                See full summary »

26.name: Hallelujah
26.description: A sharecropper decides to become a preacher after falling for a vamp from the city.

27.name: Welcome Danger
27.description: Harold Bledsoe, a botany student, is called back home to San Francisco, where his late father had been police chief, to help investigate a crime wave in Chinatown.

28.name: The Locked Door
28.description: On her first anniversary Ann Reagan finds that her sister-in-law is involved with a shady character from her own past, and determines to intervene.

29.name: The Mysterious Island
29.description: On a volcanic island near the kingdom of Hetvia rules Count Dakkar, a benevolent leader and scientist who has eliminated class distinction among the island's inhabitants. Dakkar, his ...                See full summary »

30.name: The Black Watch
30.description: Captain Donald King of the British Army goes to India just as World War I breaks out, convincing his comrades that he is a coward. In reality, he is on a secret mission to rescue British ...                See full summary »

31.name: The Cock-Eyed World
31.description: Two Marines are sent to South Sea island where they fight over a local island girl.

32.name: Behind That Curtain
32.description: Eve Mannering realizes too late that her abusive husband is a philanderer and murderer and seeks protection with her true love, explorer John Beetham.

33.name: The Saturday Night Kid
33.description: Mayme and sister Janie are salesgirls in Ginsberg's Department Store. Mayme is in love with store clerk Bill, but Janie tries to steal him from her. Hazel, another salesgirl, is Jean Harlow's first credited role.

34.name: Glorifying the American Girl
34.description: The rise of a showgirl, Gloria Hughes, culminating in a Ziegfeld extravaganza "Glorifying the American Girl".

35.name: Die weiße Hölle vom Piz Palü
35.description: A man climbs a 12,000-foot mountain to search for his wife, who was lost on their honeymoon. Another couple makes the dangerous climb with him.

36.name: On with the Show!
36.description: A musical advertised as the first 100% natural color, all-singing production. The plot concerns a wide-eyed former hatcheck girl who takes the place of a rebellious star.

37.name: Broadway
37.description: A naive young dancer in a Broadway show innocently gets involved in backstage bootlegging and murder.

38.name: Lucky Star
38.description: Mary, a poor farm girl, meets Tim just as word comes that war has been declared. Tim enlists in the army and goes to the battlefields of Europe, where he is wounded and loses the use of his...                See full summary »

39.name: The Mysterious Dr. Fu Manchu
39.description: During the Boxer Rebellion in China during the early 20th century, in which a Chinese secret society attacked all westerners and anyone who associated with them, Dr. Fu Manchu's wife and ...                See full summary »

40.name: Show of Shows
40.description: It's 1929. The studio gave the cinema its voice gave offered the audiences a chance to see their favorite actors and actresses from the silent screen era to see and for the first time can ...                See full summary »

41.name: Spite Marriage
41.description: An unimpressive but well intending man is given the chance to marry a popular actress, of whom he has been a hopeless fan. But what he doesn't realize is that he is being used to make the actress' old flame jealous.

42.name: Happy Days
42.description: Margie, singer on a showboat, decides to try her luck in New York inspite of being in love with the owners grandson. She is successful, but suddenly she hears that the showboat is in deep ...                See full summary »

43.name: The Squall
43.description: The activities of Nubi (Myrna Loy), a minx-like, Hungarian gypsy girl who, while on the run from her abusive husband, takes shelter in a farmhouse, where she seduces and holds in thrall all the male members of the family.

44.name: Applause
44.description: A burlesque star seeks to keep her convent-raised daughter away from her low-down life and abusive lover/stage manager.

45.name: The Hole in the Wall
45.description: Mrs. Ramsey sent Jean Oliver to prison on a false charge. To get even, Jean (disguised as Madame Mystera) plans to kidnap her daughter and turn her into a thief. Love entanglements with a ...                See full summary »

46.name: Their Own Desire
46.description: Lally is a rich girl whose father writes books and plays Polo. After 23 years of marriage, he decides to divorce his wife, and marry Mrs. Chevers. This sours Lally on all men, while on ...                See full summary »

47.name: Wild Orchids
47.description: A prince in Java tries to seduce his visitor's wife, but he's discovered.

48.name: The Wolf of Wall Street
48.description: A ruthless stockbroker sells short in the copper business and ruins the life of his friends by ruining their finances.

49.name: Bulldog Drummond
49.description: A bored WWI veteran helps out a young woman, whose uncle is being held hostage by embezzlers.

50.name: Words and Music
50.description: Phil and Pete compete for Mary's love and also in a contest for best song written by a college student.
